name: kubetail
description: Kubetail is a tool for tailing logs from multiple Kubernetes pods at once. It aggregates logs in a single stream, easing debugging in distributed systems, and is typically used as a CLI in terminal workflows.
features: Multi-Pod Logs: Tail logs from multiple Kubernetes pods simultaneously. Debug distributed applications efficiently.
Single Stream: Aggregate logs into unified stream with pod identification. See all logs in one view.
Real-Time Tailing: Live log streaming as new entries are written. Monitor applications in real-time.
Pod Selection: Select pods by name, label selector, or deployment. Target specific workloads.
Namespace Filtering: Filter logs by Kubernetes namespace. Focus on relevant applications.
Color Coding: Distinguish pods with color-coded output. Identify log sources quickly.
Search & Filter: Search log content and filter by patterns. Find specific log entries.
Container Selection: Choose specific containers within pods to tail. Narrow focus to relevant logs.
Context Lines: Show surrounding context for matched log lines. Understand log context better.
Timestamp Display: Show timestamps for log entries. Track when events occurred.
CLI Tool: Lightweight command-line tool for terminal workflows. Integrate with existing tools.
Kubernetes Native: Works with any Kubernetes cluster via kubectl. No additional setup required.
